channel.title: Firefox Question (Been bothering me)
channel.description:
Hey guys :)), Ive got a bit of a erm...(problem? I guess it is :P) anyways, you know how when you download in something like say, IE, it asks you if you want to run or save the program? Well, on FF it just gives me the option to save a file...
I really get annoyed by this because if its an install file I prefer to just run it insted of saving it. I guess if I have to though=\...Anyways,
If anyone has any idea what I can do to change this, please let me know ASAP =]]

item.title: Firefox Question (Been bothering me)
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Dude, it does that exact same thing. I keep on looking and looking and couldn’t find it. Is it my version? Is there a type of option I need to check or enabled or w/e?

Read full topic

item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Hope it works for you lol.

item.title: Firefox Question (Been bothering me)
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/207?application=firefox&id=207&vid=459

and also i take back what i said about use MSIE or WE because i wasn’t thinking, the Windows Kernel is what deals with .exes lel, i feel dumb now.

Read full topic

item.description:
@rspoon wrote:

item.title: Firefox Question (Been bothering me)
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

You’re welcome, you could also try associating .exe files(assuming this is what you want to run) with Windows Explorer or MSIE lel, probably more trouble than its worth though.

Edit:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:10, topic:92452”][quote author=rspoon link=topic=134431.msg1297164#msg1297164 date=1178868387]
W00T thanks Ive been looking for an extension like that forever :)) Thanks so much

Btw, yes I have 2.0
[/quote]

There’s a version 2.1 or something out, you should upgrade.[/quote]

I’m running 2.0.0.3 and I have the open with option, it just doesn’t run .exes(or give the option) because there isn’t a program associated with .exe files.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox Question (Been bothering me)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

One of the version 2’s doesn’t have an option to “open with”, but just upgrade it, or have a fiddle in the options.(Edit > Preferences or Tools > Options in Windows(?Maybe Mac?))

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox Question (Been bothering me)
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

forgot only certain files types give you the option, get this extension im pretty sure it allows you to run: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/256?id=256&application=firefox

and btw all running something does in IE is save the file to a temp. folder and sometimes doesn’t even delete it which still takes up room lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox Question (Been bothering me)
item.dc:creator: @rspoon rspoon
item.description:
@rspoon wrote:

Okay, any idea what section would be a good one? Btw, Jb it doesnt give me the run option. Plus, theres no option under my downloads section to turn on/off a run option…Only asks me where I want to save it =\

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:3, topic:92452”]Tools > Options
Somewhere there. Also, wrong section ;)[/quote]
Tool>options>main but im pretty sure that is just where it saves too, but when you goto download something it either says open with or save i believe.
